Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: トミッチ
Entry.EnglishText: Tomich

Entry.JapaneseText: ミーシャ
Entry.EnglishText: Misha

Entry.JapaneseText: キュリア
Entry.EnglishText: Curia

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: <Agarte>
Entry.EnglishText: <Agarte>

Entry.JapaneseText: 酒場の主人
Entry.EnglishText: Bar Manager

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナール
Entry.EnglishText: Minal

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナール
Entry.EnglishText: Minal

Entry.JapaneseText: 食堂
Entry.EnglishText: Dining Hall

Entry.JapaneseText: 食堂
Entry.EnglishText: Dining Hall

Entry.JapaneseText: 港への道
Entry.EnglishText: Road to Harbor

Entry.JapaneseText: ふう、なんとか ゴマかせたネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Whew, we managed to weasel our way out of that one!

Entry.JapaneseText: そのようだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Seems so.

Entry.JapaneseText: それより、これからどうする？ 港にあった船を奪うか？
Entry.EnglishText: More importantly, what's our next move? Should we hijack a ship?

Entry.JapaneseText: 下手に騒ぎを起こせば、 正規軍と戦う事になる。 無用な戦いは避けるべきだ。
Entry.EnglishText: If we cause a commotion, we'll have to fight the Callegean Army. We should avoid any unnecessary confrontation.

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、どうしたら……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Then what are we supposed to do?

Entry.JapaneseText: 船ならありますぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: If it's a ship you need, then look no further!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何者だ？
Entry.EnglishText: And you are?

Entry.JapaneseText: あっしは、トミッチ。 お見受けしたところ、 ダンナたち、ワケありのようで？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm Tomich. I couldn't help but notice you nice fellas could use some assistance. Am I right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクたちの話、 盗み聞きしてたの？
Entry.EnglishText: You mean, you were eavesdropping on us?

Entry.JapaneseText: めっそうもございません。 港で軍のやつらとモメてるのを見て、 もしかしたら船が要るんじゃないかと？
Entry.EnglishText: I wouldn't put it that way. I just happened to witness your little spat with the port guard. Would I be right in assuming you need a boat?

Entry.JapaneseText: たいした洞察力だな。 何か船に乗るツテでもあるのか？
Entry.EnglishText: That's rather perceptive of you. Do you know of a way to help us?

Entry.JapaneseText: あっしはこの街で細々と 漁師をやってるんでさあ。 ですが、港が閉鎖されちまって、 海とにらめっこする毎日……
Entry.EnglishText: I am but a humble fisherman who is trying to make ends meet. But with the port being closed, my days are now spent gazing at the sea...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……金が目的か？ いくらだ？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Is it money you're after? What's your price?

Entry.JapaneseText: さすが旦那、話が早い！ まあ、１０００ガルドって とこですかね。
Entry.EnglishText: You get straight to the point! Let's see... 1000 Gald should do the trick.

Entry.JapaneseText: すぐに船に乗れるのか？
Entry.EnglishText: And we could leave right away?

Entry.JapaneseText: 少々準備にお時間はいただきますが、 できましたら、ご案内しますぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll need time to make the preparations, but when it's ready, I'll take you to my boat.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんかすっごく、 うさんくさいんですけど。
Entry.EnglishText: Something smells fishy about this.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あっしはどっちでもいいんですよ。 船が必要なのはみなさんですから。
Entry.EnglishText: It won't hurt my feelings if you don't take me up on my offer. You folk aren't the only ones in need of a boat, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: もし船が必要なら、 街の入り口まで来てくださいな。
Entry.EnglishText: If you still need one though, then please meet me at the town entrance.

Entry.JapaneseText: ではまた……
Entry.EnglishText: Well then, good-bye for now...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……今のはアヤシすぎるって。
Entry.EnglishText: ...That guy seems pretty shifty.

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、他にアテもない。
Entry.EnglishText: Though, it's not like we have any other options.

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、アテはあるかも！
Entry.EnglishText: Wait, I have an idea!

Entry.JapaneseText: あの箱、見てよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Look at that crate.

Entry.JapaneseText: ホラ、あの箱、 カレギア軍のマークが 描いてあるでしょ？ お届け先は……？
Entry.EnglishText: Doesn't it have the Callegean Army's insignia on it? That means it must be headed to...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……軍の船か？
Entry.EnglishText: ...An army ship?

Entry.JapaneseText: だよね？ ついてったら、一緒に船に 乗り込めるんじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: It's gotta be! If we stick with that man, we might be able to board a ship, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、そんな簡単に……
Entry.EnglishText: That sounds too easy...

Entry.JapaneseText: とりあえず、あのおじさんに 話を聞いてみようよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, let's at least try talking to him.

Entry.JapaneseText: あれ、皆さん？ 急いで出ていったから、 もう街にいないと思ってたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, you're still here? You left in such a hurry, I'd thought you'd be long gone from Minal by now.

Entry.JapaneseText: 港が封鎖されちゃっててさ。 船に乗れなくて困ってるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The port's been closed off. We can't catch a ship, so we're in a bind.

Entry.JapaneseText: 船はムリですよ。 もう一週間近く、 あんな状態なんですから。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, boats are a no-go. It's been like this for about a week now.

Entry.JapaneseText: 海を渡りたいなら、他の港に 回ってみたらいかがですか？
Entry.EnglishText: If you want to travel by sea, why not try another port somewhere else?

Entry.JapaneseText: やはり、 その方法しかないか……
Entry.EnglishText: That may be our only option, after all...

Entry.JapaneseText: ところで、 <Annie>の具合は？
Entry.EnglishText: By the way, how's <Annie> doing?

Entry.JapaneseText: それが…… まだ、眠ったままです。
Entry.EnglishText: Well... She's still asleep.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか……すまんが、 <Annie>の事を頼む。
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Take care of <Annie> for us.

Entry.JapaneseText: はい、まかせてください!! あの……ところで……
Entry.EnglishText: Of course, you can count on us! Um, by the way...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうした？
Entry.EnglishText: What is it?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。あの……そちらの、 コワイ顔をしたあなた……
Entry.EnglishText: Uh, well... You over there, with the scary face...

Entry.JapaneseText: オレ……の事か？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you talking to me?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい……
Entry.EnglishText: Yes...

Entry.JapaneseText: コワイ顔だって！
Entry.EnglishText: "Scary face," hah!

Entry.JapaneseText: す、すいません……！ ……もしかしてあなた、 <Veigue>さんじゃありませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: S-Sorry! Are you <Veigue> by any chance?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なぜ、オレの名前を!?
Entry.EnglishText: How do you know my name?

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱり、そうなんですね？ そうじゃないかと思ってたんです。
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, so it is you! I thought it might be.

Entry.JapaneseText: 前に先生のところに来た患者さんが あなたの事を言ってたんですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Earlier, a patient who came to see Doctor Curia spoke about you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 背が高くて、怖い顔してて、 大きな剣を持った髪の長い、 <Veigue>って名前のヒューマが 来るかもしれないって。
Entry.EnglishText: She said a tall, long-haired Huma named <Veigue> with a sword and a scary face might come here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 誰だ、その患者というのは……？
Entry.EnglishText: Who was this patient?

Entry.JapaneseText: 名前はよく知らないんですけど、 ちょうどあなたと同じ歳くらいの ヒューマの女の人でした。
Entry.EnglishText: I didn't catch her name, but she was a Huma girl around your age.

Entry.JapaneseText: それってまさか……
Entry.EnglishText: Could it be...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア……？ クレアなのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Claire...? Was her name Claire!?

Entry.JapaneseText: え……さあ……詳しい話は 先生に聞いてみないと……
Entry.EnglishText: Well...I'm not too sure. If you want details you'll have to ask Doctor Curia.

Entry.JapaneseText: 先生はまだ宿屋にいるんだな？
Entry.EnglishText: Is she still at the inn?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。 <Annie>さんを診てます。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes. She's taking care of <Annie>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 行こう……！
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……
Entry.EnglishText: Of course.

Entry.JapaneseText: 先生、ミーシャは 見つかった？
Entry.EnglishText: Doctor, did you find Misha?

Entry.JapaneseText: いいえ…… どこにもいないの。
Entry.EnglishText: No... He's nowhere to be found.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何をそんなに 慌てているんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: What are you so panicked about?

Entry.JapaneseText: お願い…… ミーシャを助けて……
Entry.EnglishText: Please... Help save Misha...

Entry.JapaneseText: 早く見つけて落ち着かせなければ、 ミーシャは……ミーシャの フォルスが暴走してしまうわ!!
Entry.EnglishText: If we don't find him soon and calm him down, his...his Force will go berserk!

Entry.JapaneseText: あいつも能力者なのか？
Entry.EnglishText: He's a Force user, too?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうよ。 あの子も<Blue>ラドラスの落日<White>で 覚醒した能力者のひとり……
Entry.EnglishText: Yes. That child was one of many whose power awakened during the <Blue>Dusk of Ladras<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、どうして今ごろ 暴走しちゃうの？
Entry.EnglishText: But why would he lose control of it now?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>が言った言葉…… ミーシャはあれと同じ事を、 前にも言われた事があるのよ。 それも、大好きなお母さんに……
Entry.EnglishText: What <Annie> said to him... Such words have been said to him before, by his beloved mother...

Entry.JapaneseText: 母親に？
Entry.EnglishText: His mother?

Entry.JapaneseText: ミーシャのフォルスが発現した時、 フォルスに驚いたお母さんは、思わず 「来ないで」と言ってしまった。
Entry.EnglishText: When Misha's Force awakened, his frightened mother couldn't help but tell him to "Stay away."

Entry.JapaneseText: そのショックで、 ミーシャのフォルスは暴走を始めた…… 偶然にも私がその場に居合わせて、 なんとか暴走は止めたけど。
Entry.EnglishText: The shock of hearing that made him lose control of his Force... I just happened to be there at the time and somehow managed to calm him down.
Entry.Notes: had to line break like this cause it was overlapping the character - pegi

Entry.JapaneseText: 結局、それが原因で、あの子は お母さんに見捨てられるような 形になってしまったの。
Entry.EnglishText: But because of that, Misha was abandoned by his mother.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから私はあの子を引き取って、 仕事の手伝いをしてもらう事に したのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: So I decided to take him in, and he became my assistant.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだったんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: No way...

Entry.JapaneseText: 暴走の一件以来、あの子は 周りからあまり好意的とは いえない扱いを受けて来たわ。 それでも、あの子はがんばった。
Entry.EnglishText: After he went berserk, Misha found himself being treated rather poorly by others. But despite that, he never stopped trying his best.

Entry.JapaneseText: あれ以来、暴走もなく、 ようやく周りもあの子を 受け入れてくれるように なってきてたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Since then, he hasn't lost control of his Force once, and people have finally started to accept him.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここでまた暴走を 起こしてしまったら、 あの子はどうなるの……!?
Entry.EnglishText: If he were to once again lose control of his Force after all this time, I don't even want to think about what would happen to him!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ボクたちが助ける。
Entry.EnglishText: ...We'll save him.

Entry.JapaneseText: ゴメンね、<Veigue>。 先を急ぎたいのはわかるけど、 ボク、ミーシャを放っとけないヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry, <Veigue>. I know you want to get a move on, but I can't leave Misha like this.

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Why?

Entry.JapaneseText: フォルスの暴走で、 ボクは記憶を失った。
Entry.EnglishText: I lost my memory when my Force went berserk.

Entry.JapaneseText: お父さんの事も、お母さんの事も、 みんな忘れちゃったけど…… ボクも、ミーシャみたいに 見放されたのかもしれない……
Entry.EnglishText: My mom, my dad... I don't remember anyone. I could have been abandoned by them like Misha was.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だから、ミーシャの事、 ひとごとには思えないんだヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...So I can't just ignore what he's going through.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>…… おまえにも覚えはないか？
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>... Have you forgotten what it was like?

Entry.JapaneseText: フォルスの暴走に クレアさんを巻き込んだ時、 周りの反応はどうだった？
Entry.EnglishText: When you lost control of your Force and trapped Claire in ice, how did those around you react?

Entry.JapaneseText: おじさんとおばさんが オレをかばってくれなければ…… 今ごろは……
Entry.EnglishText: If Mr. and Mrs. Bennett hadn't stood up for me, I probably would have been...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>……
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ミーシャを助けに行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Let's go find Misha.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Veigue>！
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>!

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>、フォルスを感じるか？
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>, can you sense his Force?

Entry.JapaneseText: まだ、どっちの方角かは わからないけど、 フォルスの高まりを感じるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I still don't know which direction it's coming from, but I can feel a strong Force presence nearby.

Entry.JapaneseText: 急ごう。
Entry.EnglishText: Then let's hurry.

Entry.JapaneseText: みなさん、やめてください！ どうして毎日こんな風に ケンカしなくちゃいけないんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone, please just stop! Why do you keep on fighting like this, day in and day out?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ケガ人ばかり出して、 いい加減になさい！
Entry.EnglishText: This is doing nothing but getting people hurt! Get a hold of yourselves at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: どきな、先生!!
Entry.EnglishText: Out of the way, Doctor!

Entry.JapaneseText: よせ！
Entry.EnglishText: That's enough!

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた、その腕……！
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, your arm...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 大丈夫ですか、先生!?
Entry.EnglishText: Are you hurt, Doctor?

Entry.JapaneseText: え、ええ…… 私は大丈夫だけど……
Entry.EnglishText: N-No, I'm all right...

Entry.JapaneseText: あ、おまえ……！ まさかガジュマの味方を するわけじゃないだろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: Why, you...! Don't tell me you're siding with the Gajuma?!

Entry.JapaneseText: どっちの味方でもない。 オレは、種族間のばかげた 争いを止めたいだけだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not taking anyone's side. I just want to put an end to these stupid racial conflicts!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なんだとぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: What...?!

Entry.JapaneseText: この裏切り者！ おまえは引っ込んでろ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're a damn traitor! You have no right to interfere!

Entry.JapaneseText: いいから、ガジュマどもを この街から追い出しちまおうぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: You know what? Let's just kick these Gajuma out of town!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、やっちまえ！
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, let's do it!

Entry.JapaneseText: 大変だ！ 軍だ！ 軍が来たぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: Bad news, everyone! It's the army! The army's here!

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍!? 軍が何しに 来たんだー!?
Entry.EnglishText: The army? What are they doing here?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここにもカレギア軍が……
Entry.EnglishText: So the Callegean Army has come here as well...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマの騒乱を 聞きつけて来たんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: They must be here because they were notified of the disturbances.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……とりあえず、しばらくは 静かになりそうね。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, things should settle down now for the time being.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここで立ち話もなんだし、 宿屋へ行きましょう。 お茶ぐらいごちそうするわ。
Entry.EnglishText: We should talk at the inn instead of standing around here. I'll treat you all to some tea.

Entry.JapaneseText: クルルルゥ……
Entry.EnglishText: Coo... Coo...

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、ヒューマは外出禁止だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, Huma aren't permitted to be outside.

Entry.JapaneseText: 人を探しているんだ。 どいてくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: We're looking for someone. Get out of the way.

Entry.JapaneseText: ダメなものはダメだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The rules are the rules.

Entry.JapaneseText: お願いします。 とても大切な人なんです。
Entry.EnglishText: Please, she's very important to us.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……おやっ？ あんた…… アガーテ様に似てるような 気がするなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Oh? You there... You look an awful lot like Queen Agarte...

Entry.JapaneseText: おーい、みんな来てくれ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey guys, come on over here!

Entry.JapaneseText: なぁ、この娘…… アガーテ様に似てると 思わないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Doesn't this girl bear a strong resemblance to Queen Agarte?

Entry.JapaneseText: 確かに良く似てる。 ああ……アガーテ様だ。
Entry.EnglishText: She does look a lot like her. Yep, that's Queen Agarte.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は…… 私はアガーテ様じゃ ありません……
Entry.EnglishText: I... I'm not Queen Agarte...!

Entry.JapaneseText: わかってるよ。 アガーテ様が、おまえたちなんかと こんなところにいるはずがないだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: You think we don't know that? You think the Queen would be loitering around here with a ragtag group like yours?

Entry.JapaneseText: それにしても、そっくりだよなぁ。 案外、本物だったりしてな？
Entry.EnglishText: Still, the resemblance is uncanny. Almost makes me wonder if she is the real thing.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……違う…… アガーテじゃない……
Entry.EnglishText: No... She's not Agarte...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……アガーテじゃない…… クレアだ……
Entry.EnglishText: She isn't Agarte... She's Claire.

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: She's Queen Agarte.

Entry.JapaneseText: うん、アガーテ様だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yep, it's Queen Agarte.

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様、万歳！
Entry.EnglishText: Long live Queen Agarte!

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテと呼ぶな!!
Entry.EnglishText: Stop calling her Agarte!!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何だと!?
Entry.EnglishText: The hell is your problem?!

Entry.JapaneseText: これはクレアだ…… クレアだ……クレアだ……！
Entry.EnglishText: She's Claire... Claire... Claire...

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだこいつ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's with this guy?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あぁぁぁ…… ……うわぁぁぁぁぁぁッ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Aaaagh... Aaaaaghhh!!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>!!
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>!!

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、あれは……!? みんな、<Veigue>を追うんだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: No... Don't tell me... We need to follow <Veigue>!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、あれ……？ フォルス……か……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's that...? F-Force...?

Entry.JapaneseText: お、俺たちは悪くねえぞ！ ただ、一緒にいる女が あまりにもアガーテ様にだな……
Entry.EnglishText: W-We did nothing wrong! It's just that the woman who's with you looks so much like Queen Agarte!

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだよ、アイツ…… 急に……
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What's up with that guy...?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだね？ 今、ちょっと 取り込み中なんだが……
Entry.EnglishText: What is it? I'm a little busy at the moment here...

Entry.JapaneseText: その箱、どこに 持っていくの？
Entry.EnglishText: Where are you taking that box?

Entry.JapaneseText: 港に泊まっている軍の船に 運び込むのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's gonna be loaded onto one of the army vessels docked at the harbor.

Entry.JapaneseText: へえ、大変そうだね。
Entry.EnglishText: Wow, that sounds like hard work for you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、いつもは 若いのにやらせるんだが、 あいにく休みでね。
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, usually one of my young'uns would take care of it, but it's his day off.

Entry.JapaneseText: この歳になると力仕事もきつくて、 さっきからこんな調子さ。 休み休みで仕事がちっともはかどらない。 困ったもんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: This kind of labor really takes it out of you when you're my age. I don't make much progress because I need to take breaks often. It's a real pain...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうなんだー。
Entry.EnglishText: That's too bad.

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえねえ、ボクたちで 手伝ってあげない？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, why don't we help him out?

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな事をしている ヒマはないはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: We don't have the time for that.

Entry.JapaneseText: だからさ、お手伝いを口実にさ、 船に乗り込むコトもできるじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: No, I mean we might be able to use helping him as an excuse to board a ship!

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、乗り込めたところで、 その先の保証はないし、 危険が大きい……
Entry.EnglishText: Even if we make it onto a ship, there's no guarantee it'll be smooth sailing. It's a risky move.

Entry.JapaneseText: まあ、そうなんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Well, I guess you're right...

Entry.JapaneseText: トミッチの船にするか、それとも、 あのおじさんの手伝いをして 船に乗り込むか。 それがモンダイだね。
Entry.EnglishText: Should we take up Tomich's offer, or take our chances boarding a ship this way? What a predicament!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、おじさん。 ボクたちでよければ 手伝ってあげようか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey mister, would you like for us to help you out?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当か？ うーん……ぼうずはともかく、 そっちの二人は力ありそうだな。 ……お願いしてもいいのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Really? Hmm...you're a little small for it, but those two look pretty strong. You really don't mind giving me a hand?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:120> ああ、運ぶよ ちょっと待ってくれ
Entry.EnglishText: We'll carry it Wait a second

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、運ぶよ。
Entry.EnglishText: We'll carry it.

Entry.JapaneseText: いやあ、本当に助かる！ お礼に今晩、名物料理を ごちそうするよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Wow, that's a weight off my back! To show my thanks, stop by my bar and I'll serve you Minal's local specialty! Free of charge!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>届け物の木箱を持ちました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Wooden Box acquired

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ちょっと待ってくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Wait a second.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、いいけど、 日が暮れるまでには 運び込むように言われてるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Alright, but I need to get this to the ship before sunset.

Entry.JapaneseText: 手伝ってもらえるんなら 早めにお願いしたいんだが……
Entry.EnglishText: If you're going to help me, I'll need you sooner rather than later.

Entry.JapaneseText: わかった……
Entry.EnglishText: Understood.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたの？ トミッチの ところへ行ってみる？
Entry.EnglishText: What do you want to do? Should we go see what Tomich is up to?

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当、助かるよ。 これがまた重くてさ……
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks a lot, this thing's really heavy.

Entry.JapaneseText: 向こうに立ってる奴は 極端なヒューマ嫌いなんだそうだ。 ま、あんたにゃ関係ないか。
Entry.EnglishText: That guy over there seems to really hate Huma... Well, it's none of your concern.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは外出禁止に なっている……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are forbidden from going outdoors.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だそうだ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Or at least they're supposed to be.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、捕まりたくなかったら、 屋内に入ってた方が いいんじゃねえか？
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe you should stay inside if you don't want to get arrested?

Entry.JapaneseText: うぉぉ……な、なんだ、 このヘンな音……
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-Whoa... What was that sound just now...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 地震にしてはずいぶん長いし 様子も少し違う……何なんだ!?
Entry.EnglishText: This earthquake has been going on for so long and seems so odd... Just what the hell is going on?!

Entry.JapaneseText: すごい地鳴りだったな。 冷や汗でびっちょりだ……
Entry.EnglishText: What a tremor, that made me break out in cold sweat!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……俺、この仕事、 向いてないのかも……
Entry.EnglishText: Do you think... I'm still suited for this job?

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺も、この状況は怖いさ…… でも、この国を守りたくて 兵士になったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm scared too... But I became a soldier to protect this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何があっても、 人々を守るぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: No matter what happens, I'll protect the people!

Entry.JapaneseText: 上からは、ヒューマに 厳しくするよう 言われてるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: The higher ups have ordered us to be strict with Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、なんか不公平な 気がしてさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I get the feeling that we're discriminating against them...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを野放しにする ガジュマも罪に問われるぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll have no choice but to charge you if you let those Huma out of your sight!

Entry.JapaneseText: ちゃんと監視しろよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'll be keeping an eye on you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは家の中へ 入ってろ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Go back indoors, Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: それとも命令に逆らって 牢屋に放り込まれたいか？
Entry.EnglishText: Or perhaps you'd like to disobey me and find yourself inside a prison cell instead?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの連中は 何を企んでるんだ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: What do you think you're doing, Huma!?

Entry.JapaneseText: こ、これは……おまえら ヒューマの仕業だな!?
Entry.EnglishText: D-Did you H-Huma do this!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを信頼するな！ あの地鳴りもヒューマの 陰謀に違いない!!
Entry.EnglishText: Don't trust the Huma! I bet that they were also behind that earthquake!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマめ！ 一体、何を企んでやがる！
Entry.EnglishText: What are you planning, Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを この世界から追い出そうったって そうはいかんぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I won't let you Huma chase Gajuma out of this world!

Entry.JapaneseText: 外は危険だ！ バイラスに気をつけるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: It's dangerous outside! Watch out for Biruses!

Entry.JapaneseText: この街は、 カレギア軍の監視下にある。 騒ぎを起こすんじゃないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: This town is under the Callegean Army's supervision. Don't you think of doing anything funny.

Entry.JapaneseText: お船に乗るの？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you getting on a ship?

Entry.JapaneseText: 港はあっちの海が 見えてる方だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The harbor's just over there by the sea!

Entry.JapaneseText: 知りたい事があるの？ うちのパパに聞いてみれば？ 色んな事、知ってるよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Is there something you want to know? Ask my Papa! He knows a lot of things!

Entry.JapaneseText: パパはね、 お役所の三階で働いてるの。
Entry.EnglishText: He works at the third floor of the government office!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今日はパパはね、お仕事中。 お役所で働いてるんだよ？
Entry.EnglishText: My Papa's in the middle of work today! Did you know that he works in the government office?

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近のパパ、 ちょっとイライラしてて、 ちょっとコワイ……
Entry.EnglishText: You know, my Papa's been in a scary mood lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: 兵隊さんが来たけど、 私たちはいつもどおりだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Some soldiers came by earlier, but things haven't changed for us.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一緒にミナール体操…… しない？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you want to do Minal gymnastics with us?

Entry.JapaneseText: 東のお空に、真っ黒な雲が 集まってるように見えるけど…… フキツね……
Entry.EnglishText: A bunch of ominous dark clouds started gathering in the east... I don't like the sound of that...

Entry.JapaneseText: スゴイ音がしたね……
Entry.EnglishText: That was so loud...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも今日はパパが一緒だし、 へいっちゃらだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: But, as long as I'm with Papa, I got nothing to be afraid of!

Entry.JapaneseText: これはね、 ミナール体操っていうの。 ……一緒にどう？
Entry.EnglishText: What am I doing? I'm doing Minal gymnastics! Wanna join?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヘレンという娘がいなくなったと 騒いでる人がいましたが……
Entry.EnglishText: People were making a ruckus about how a girl named Helen went missing...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうなったの でしょうかね……？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what happened?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの男の子？ さあ、ここらでは 見ませんでしたが……
Entry.EnglishText: A Gajuma boy? No idea, I didn't see one around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、腹の立つ事が 多いのです。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been feeling angry a lot lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: でもこうやって体を動かせば、 イライラも全部、 吹き飛んでしまうのですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: But when I get my body moving, I can feel my irritation fade away.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……試してみませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps you should give it a try?

Entry.JapaneseText: 仕事のうえでも ヒューマの方が少し 賃金が高いのです。
Entry.EnglishText: The Huma at my work earn more than I do.

Entry.JapaneseText: やってる仕事は同じなのに…… それが納得いかないのです。
Entry.EnglishText: Even though we perform the same job... That's unacceptable, if you ask me.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマにだって、 私のように頭脳労働に 向いてる者だっていますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Even amongst Gajuma, there are some like myself who are more suited for intellectual labor.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうして、あなたたちヒューマは それをわかろうとしないのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Why can't you Huma understand that?

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍隊が来たからといって、 ミナールがガジュマにとって 住み心地よくなるわけではありません。
Entry.EnglishText: Just because the army occupies Minal doesn't mean that we Gajuma have it any better.

Entry.JapaneseText: 以前よりも、なんとなく 息苦しいです……
Entry.EnglishText: Things feel somewhat...suffocating, compared to how things were.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の音でしょう……？ まるで海が割れるような……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what that noise was...? It's as though the sea is being split apart...

Entry.JapaneseText: しかしそんな…… 海が割れるなんて…… まさか……
Entry.EnglishText: But... The sea splitting apart? That's impossible...

Entry.JapaneseText: 海の向こうからすごい音が…… どうしたのでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: There was a loud noise coming out of the sea... I wonder what that was about.

Entry.JapaneseText: 休みの日にはいつもこうやって 娘と遊ぶ時間を作っています。
Entry.EnglishText: I always take the time to play with my daughter on my days off.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
